page.title: 14WINTER FUEL
page.content: Most people in this area use coal as their main fuel.Two coal merchants travel 84 km to deliver coal.Coal can cost{Â£122}a{tonne, winter price . However there is an excellent fuel that you can get for nothing if you are prepared to do a few days hard work. First of all you must get permission from{MR.E.VESTEY}the{landowner.}Then you find a suitable{peat}bog.After that you cut the edge off with a spade ,cut lines in the turf,take it out,then using a{tusk}you cut out the blocks of peat.You replace the turf,leave the blocks for three or four weeks to dry,stacking them in small piles and weather permitting they should be ready to take home by July or August. Sitting round your peat fire on a cold winter's night makes it all worthwhile.
